com.github.rholder.fauxflake.api

Interface IdGenerator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultIdGenerator

    public interface IdGenerator
    Implementations of this interface are the primary entry points for generating unique identifiers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Id generateId(int maxWait)
      Return a unique identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • generateId

        Id generateId(int maxWait)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Return a unique identifier. This should be resilient enough to handle leap seconds, however, backwards time that occurs when the system time is updated, as from NTP, will result in an InterruptedException. NOTE: Generating more id's at a time than can be handled may result in the current thread blocking for maxWait ms to ensure a new timestamp is available.
        Parameters:
        maxWait - the maximum amount of time to wait in ms before giving up
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown when thread is interrupted, the maximum amount of time to wait for a new timestamp to become available has expired, or backwards time has been detected
